item.title: [Rs2 private servers] Ranged Trainer! [Rs2 private servers] UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @ryefox2 ryefox2
item.description:
@ryefox2 wrote:

Mmk I’ve created a fix. I havn’t actually tested this so I need someone to test it.
In the fix if it can’t find the DTM (which atm is set to v-bright so set your client to v-bright)
It will attempt to use a different method to click the targets. Of course I don’t actually know if it will use the optional method which is why I need some testers. Remember to set the color KTHXBYE

heres the scripts [scar]// Range Trainer for private servers
// By Ryefox2.
// Contact me for any questions (cant_touc_dis@hotmail.com)
// Thanks.

// Note: Start the script logged out anywhere, since the script types ::range
// if the server doesn’t support ::range make sure your near the targets.
// Enter your username and password in lines 12/13.
// Pick the color of the target in setup otherwise script may not work.

program RangeTrainer;
var enter,loginbutton,i,closewindow,target,x,y: integer;
const
//Setup//
User=‘ryefox2’;
Pass=‘lolthisismypass’; //How many times to click target, it takes 95 to get lvl 90.
clicks=0; // How many times to click? 95 clicks should get you lvl 90 ranged .
alreadyloggedin=1; // are you already logged in? (0=no 1=yes)
color1=0; //Must pick the colour of the target. This will be used as a backup is the DTM doesn’t work
//End//

procedure Login;
begin

Loginbutton := BitmapFromString(57, 19, ‘z78DAB558CB92C3200’ +
‘CFBA54C71BAEDB19D6DFEFF9376A6E4A08C90919B2E071F886340’ +
‘C82FE21211AF78CBF66A5BDCBB8C5B3CD6F89A64FB7DDD13D6769’ +
‘B8FF68C68D7768B65977D0656C17577D975F0DF4B6BED799064ED’ +
‘F02F7E256B87D3C16E951C2083D2B19323F61BDBFA28DC119F8B3’ +
‘1A43D4B1D85B3C25048C5010B25F5EF47AC1BDC1D61E5E8284DC5’ +
‘8A819D9CB7EA1E11559F9F82098A631B0CCB97154AECADCA37733’ +
‘F72EECE918C067315D130BCDEDF33A2BABC8762786E735F17F1B4’ +
‘F7E0305646CE13D2F147FFEC88DB045575BA2A67C4AE267143AD9’ +
‘8FB4215D5CE58E42DCEE41944C4E101AAB947A8C8C6391D75288E’ +
‘3102B8934225007E51C88088AA93B51DF6E6A8A6916D1343C5B48’ +
‘93E9D7D81C13B1CD8E9D83A9503DDD4009F2A3FEDB8AAF6C09A7D’ +
‘0C38E6EB8317AB3B62240776A83A9D78595A6FC84AD2A927F3B86’ +
‘AE7B5F3F3EA163A0F9DDB417D8E482AEB85DF5BD9784A548B9A85’ +
‘F92ADAEF33FA68FB7591AA01646E2DF69516AA695E3B8F6A95AB0’ +
‘AED014AAA9B53D933E7B0DD736DC640CB4AE79065C45DA8BF7A3C’ +
‘2C7055E957EB558C9646753A89C034B318C3D1573738898750832’ +
‘96B388F91F330CFE8618CCD7B2BE335635027B085BCFA3DFD4A50’ +
‘AE3AD4AB14F7F86A46BD06084DA7631D445746F533597D6F21CFC’ +
‘D2B2ED9EFAB9A9F7BABBC371136275DD2B7D0F3599AF69ED5382C’ +
‘91747A52C6967A2ED5D12086EB75FDB9B60232FFC64C5FAA387CC’ +
‘02467A0EAF195D7539DCF1C2863721AC3CF5E9CF2175DEBF583FA’ +
‘23EBAF5C47C4EA3F9A2CA5DB’);

Enter := BitmapFromString(140, 36, ‘z78DAED5DED6EDB38107C25’ +
‘DB92D3F667726DDEFF915A44056E8DF50C67B84BFB828B8B12814’ +
‘45372B2A3D98FE1FAFCCFF9E7E574FE84E3E5C7E5F5F21E477D66’ +
‘65442B777D8ACAFDCC5DF731BFABB9BFDDA719B7F37EBE7EFA4FF’ +
‘1357E8D4FC2CEE9EDDF7FC791FDE7FE7E7DDDBFEFAFD7FDF8F9FA’ +
‘72FDF6B2C57170F65861C5785C378DDBEBF6B6EFFBE5CFFF5F79D’ +
‘C7E6DEFFB8FF8F3313FBE0B1DBF391BD651C6BCE6CD18CFF299C7’ +
‘F8B27DDF4FDB65DBB6B7B6915F51B987E3489C138FC711DC43E42’ +
‘37EB73A03F277755D252308E12863C41D230AEA2BCCA1ECCE4C80’ +
‘B2BF47826D4374089882738EBB9AC363B4DB702737361C31A2209’ +
‘4A32623A5B21A3A6B3E01386A566036CFD17124596CC0089ABF82’ +
‘A74A6BC6FBE74841784498CD63C40E3AEB2211A10CD946B4E1CC0’ +
‘E1C35C8FE33E370A42867337F098C36C73BF698EE81E32873C18D’ +
‘2FC7F1852C36F111E229C81D94D11AFC43C41A753634B123F9849’ +
‘98FF27CC52AD0C83DC075DEA37B570AD7705F545EBFC447C18675’ +
‘DF4C89B006EF0D966CA306D97FB2E19BA7FDD493C1461062C06C4’ +
‘B081D73F10BE20BE1A97B135DBA57777DBF824707E335EEA9E6BB’ +
‘EDC211F0D95C2E28454020C629B14FB45ED95FEDF51B3383A0E30’ +
‘3C641CF7CF45CCD5115678114219632217AE4E5B203CA6F28EC23’ +
‘5FA5946730FD2883A1B857C3230BC5FB42117D62B7361C21D4241’ +
‘F4CCF2D187110B28D8C1A6E393A53F4660EF56CA49BBD44DC3485’ +
‘1A978FE6326F867F856C1EC5E3DCC6324FE577214F8C23C8F5D6C’ +
‘2756FF2E7F535055E9362763D0320FB390D11BD1BD3295195C2CE’ +
‘E59CDE1C8E165688106A2A552AD90E4BB68D709473E375EC208F4’ +
‘8F10F5DAF0F65DA85D50616886293D64A93BBF2B37034F0D9D2D3’ +
‘BE0D9BDCBBD3F3CFBA1F55A901F1FB51188AC72619354AE4C53DB’ +
‘D7AB5C88D710A19B366C4B5E6EBEA085A5269054F7BA35AAAC459’ +
‘7AD4E6B28C9EDFCE75613007CD44BF012937CE713457D50D18512’ +
‘CBC62FFEBB0E3E6192A96BFDC27A495D34A35F38EA565B4021E79’ +
‘175E122E78468BF24E4335AAA25CE267056F6D859DF7626A058E9’ +
‘6EBE878D682C623779EEAF9BD822FA75B69C4CB89BE14BC470421’ +
‘24EA2A88412EBDAEF6A9D4580B9ED8633C37AE94D0F3DE5D7516D’ +
‘B7F7335038A8D35A9713242338EB2AF3867BD7065410D38B822E7’ +
‘BB15FAD5153A5B591754F127E7EA47939191506F32F26CBA9D1F7’ +
‘A6F251A52B2DF3A5AC3913BD6CE590F452809111C4792AFA564ED’ +
‘B28242C95D3C1023752D5CAFAF58C711B479530554D1914A75559’ +
‘41953384B612880231E13F1182AA300CE4C7E1ABF87389FAF39C8’ +
‘F2299C5551232C60A867E1C8AE7120AE1114AA766D376144C251F’ +
‘2AFEEA8830A1E238F8FB80D1F731046062B7FFCADD11C8450740F’ +
‘7FD70CFED88049EBDA3FA4DC537081EA506574ACD87F54AFAB2EC’ +
‘94E0056D27134A8909A1A54258AE188432BA0E3F153E4393947C1’ +
‘8FDF2008ED60EACA5724AB860AD8A7E6169AF5DE886B8032A737B’ +
‘337501C857B90F84BD733981A1E181FC9338DE3149B03AE011CA7’ +
‘57E20CEDB7EEEF2124EAAC84B44F8BA3B6018E74FD645DD72DE04’ +
‘8F2DC507EDB55EF4C6978241CD18C848B23DDF78B1E20F2037956’ +
‘53CA5DD431652A22E03EA307663C243EA24869DB5FD05B5D72B5D’ +
‘33457ACEB1C943A2CF2C10648048CC333E47CBE82CD878E4DD983’ +
‘92D747EB5993F111651C454DB764478FB29AA26713FA3318CAA27’ +
‘0E424BCF2CC7845743C9FBD9303FFB049A50A9C674A76BEBA3F83’ +
‘AE42A79852F40C6EB5B7611F9FEEE3E90A3477AF84D2B744C1B2E’ +
‘9EFC11D7F3C23B16CA7B9A4C1E05E4DCE7171F535B26AA55FD00A’ +
‘94B996CF3D3D145BC99EA19167E8EAE081B26AFA7E079DD114C4E’ +
‘94F86751DC3646D128A4A241D9DBBD31C5587D19A4A54D21B49B9’ +
‘7B03B98AC3DDBB54CF33142CD9AEC02A7BC02BFD46D6E165EE1E9’ +
‘2C20746F4AEBA4051FEF01E748AFE9CEF765FD09F41CA3028BD8F’ +
‘A6EA50767CC46D6CC593BC62ED3C835D61C665EC53EA2AC9FB0FE’ +
‘8AA6C647509ADB026ABF467703B3C28DD1E949D89856B710DB914’ +
‘1F21ABA3D1CA6066B9571BCFC00F62AB4A47A029D4943E11DFC92’ +
‘BC71A7617AF7A56CDF5C494C80E2108E5C9CD3DBC737DF00CBDB7’ +
‘99FBB26B9AEEFE055D7D5AA807D9B905DAA5A1B4AF7CEA5934C8B’ +
‘9293A70A59FC38ADEC8EE2E5A25EA59B697B66DDF84AE4F2B60CA’ +
‘D0C27565C61464B99C5B511FE5FE0CB49FB9842CEE012A68D2D94’ +
‘AF1A9CA752529E720F77FE8EACFD010CB94E3F7811EA9EE2F09DD’ +
‘1B06FD19941C6653C7C8B95EFD52B7F0606F6ECEB0A157C33205C’ +
‘273FB3394B404AB150E741FD0E4CE563DAE71BD417D0F885B272A’ +
‘A0897B7D6EBF97E69D146565C27FAD3F83D17FFB91CA9F3A6AA62’ +
‘C56EAA035B73790F7052A7F16BB3EC53968AE4BC343FA330C326C’ +
‘666DA88E23E9D9DBE559F5DA06C8E296BE9F8876E069B65E149BC’ +
‘CED51D52D5C1F1FF29CEFFA96A2157B8E741C49A3FE1D7FEEBB94’ +
‘D5BEBE03EE7FF33D77CD9653B15E304604FD068978B669’);

   closewindow := DTMFromString('78DA635CCFC8C0A0C180020E40694618DE052' +
   '4D571AB01D367802C65026A6E03596A04D4BCC1EF1E100000331F' +
   '088D');

   if(findbitmap(enter, x, y))then

movemousesmooth(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);

wait(1000)
sendkeyssilent(User+chr(13))
wait(1000)
sendkeyssilent(Pass)

wait(1000)

if(findbitmap(loginbutton, x, y))then

movemousesmooth(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(3000)

repeat Wait(1000)
until(FindDTM(closewindow,x,y,0,0,999,999))
wait(200)
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(2000)
clickmouse(x,y,true)
end;

procedure clicktargetDTM;
begin
i :=0

Target := DTMFromString(‘78DA637CC0C0C0308501053CBF1D05A61961F’ +
‘832A69AA8ACF9703560FA0990E84555B326D41F55CD6320319780’ +
‘9A1B40623E7EBB00C2BF0ED1’);

wait(2000)
If(not(FindDTM(target,x,y,0,0,548,362)))Then
writeln(‘Cant find the target, trying to teleport to targets!’)
wait(2000)
cleardebug;
Writeln(‘teleporting…’)
sendkeys(’::range’+chr(13))
wait(5000)

repeat
FindDTM(Target,x,y,0,0,999,999)
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(100)
clickmouse(x,y,true);
i :=i+1;
wait(2900)
cleardebug;
Writeln(‘Have clicked ’ + Inttostr(i) + ’ times’)
until(i=clicks);
cleardebug;
Writeln(‘Successfully finished training your ranged!’);
Writeln(‘And clicked the target ’ + Inttostr(i) + ’ times!’)
end;

begin
activateclient;
wait(500);
if(alreadyloggedin=0)then
begin
login;
end;
wait(1000);
if(FindDTM(Target,x,y,0,0,999,999))then
begin
clicktargetDTM;
end;
wait(5000)
if(not(findDTM(Target,x,y,0,0,999,999)))then
begin
repeat
findcolor(x,y,color1,0,0,999,999)
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(25+random(5))
clickmouse(x,y,true)
wait(200+random(200))
i :=i+1
until(i=clicks)
end;

end.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: [Rs2 private servers] Ranged Trainer! [Rs2 private servers] UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @ryefox2 ryefox2
item.description:
@ryefox2 wrote:

[glow=red,2,300]Updates!!![/glow]

  1. Added the ability to start the script logged in.
  2. If it can’t find the targets it will attempt to teleport to ::range
  3. Moved some things around abit
  4. Can now choose wait time between clicks.
  5. Added DTMS:
    Now finds the target via DTM.
    Now finds ‘Close Window’ via DTM, ALOT more accurate!

This is the first and beta version of one of my first scripts. It trains your range by clicking on the targets a specified amount of times. This is now pretty much finished. I exercised new things such as bitmaps and DTMS and other things.

First it requires for you to be logged out located near the targets. This will be changed later.
It will then log you in and begin clicking the targets. Updated! Now you have the choice to be either logged in or out! And now if it can’t find the targets it will type ::range! (Teleports to targets on MOST servers.) It will then begin clicking a specified amount of times on the targets.

Alright here it is.

{Note that I made this for learning purposes}

[scar]// Range Trainer for private servers
// By Ryefox2.
// Contact me for any questions (cant_touc_dis@hotmail.com)
// Thanks.

// Note: Start the script logged out anywhere, since the script types ::range
// if the server doesn’t support ::range make sure your near the targets.
// Enter your username and password in lines 12/13.

program RangeTrainer;
var enter,loginbutton,i,target,x,y: integer;
const
//Setup//
User=’’;
Pass=’’; //How many times to click target, it takes 95 to get lvl 90.
colour=192; // Leave this.
clicks=50; // How many times to click? 95 clicks should get you lvl 90 ranged .
alreadyloggedin=1; // are you already logged in? (0=no 1=yes)
//End//

procedure Login;
begin

Loginbutton := BitmapFromString(57, 19, ‘z78DAB558CB92C3200’ +
‘CFBA54C71BAEDB19D6DFEFF9376A6E4A08C90919B2E071F886340’ +
‘C82FE21211AF78CBF66A5BDCBB8C5B3CD6F89A64FB7DDD13D6769’ +
‘B8FF68C68D7768B65977D0656C17577D975F0DF4B6BED799064ED’ +
‘F02F7E256B87D3C16E951C2083D2B19323F61BDBFA28DC119F8B3’ +
‘1A43D4B1D85B3C25048C5010B25F5EF47AC1BDC1D61E5E8284DC5’ +
‘8A819D9CB7EA1E11559F9F82098A631B0CCB97154AECADCA37733’ +
‘F72EECE918C067315D130BCDEDF33A2BABC8762786E735F17F1B4’ +
‘F7E0305646CE13D2F147FFEC88DB045575BA2A67C4AE267143AD9’ +
‘8FB4215D5CE58E42DCEE41944C4E101AAB947A8C8C6391D75288E’ +
‘3102B8934225007E51C88088AA93B51DF6E6A8A6916D1343C5B48’ +
‘93E9D7D81C13B1CD8E9D83A9503DDD4009F2A3FEDB8AAF6C09A7D’ +
‘0C38E6EB8317AB3B62240776A83A9D78595A6FC84AD2A927F3B86’ +
‘AE7B5F3F3EA163A0F9DDB417D8E482AEB85DF5BD9784A548B9A85’ +
‘F92ADAEF33FA68FB7591AA01646E2DF69516AA695E3B8F6A95AB0’ +

   if(findbitmap(enter, x, y))then

movemousesmooth(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);

wait(1000)
sendkeyssilent(User+chr(13))
wait(1000)
sendkeyssilent(Pass)

wait(1000)

if(findbitmap(loginbutton, x, y))then

movemousesmooth(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(3000)

repeat Wait(1000)
until(FindColor(x,y,colour,0,0,548,362))
wait(200)
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(2000)
clickmouse(x,y,true)
end;

procedure clicktargets;
begin
i :=0

Target := DTMFromString(‘78DA63D4606460D8CC80021E5C7004D38C503’ +
‘EA31CA69A99B6E6A86ACC30D5380676A2A801009F6C06B8’);

wait(1000)
If(not(FindDTM(target,x,y,0,0,548,362)))Then
writeln(‘Cant find the target, trying to teleport to targets!’)
wait(2000)
cleardebug;
Writeln(‘teleporting…’)
sendkeys(’::range’+chr(13))

repeat
FindDTM(Target,x,y,0,0,999,999)
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(500)
clickmouse(x,y,true);
i :=i+1;
wait(900)
cleardebug;
Writeln(‘Have clicked ’ + Inttostr(i) + ’ times’)
until(i=clicks);
cleardebug;
Writeln(‘Successfully finished training your ranged!’);
end;

begin
activateclient;
wait(500);
if(alreadyloggedin=0)then
begin
login;
end;
wait(1000);
clicktargets;
end.[/scar]

Leave some constructive critisism that will improve the script, or even my scripting technique. Thanks.
